\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 81956}

\subsection*{Talkative and Alert}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{sia}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 40 mg & oral & 4-Fluoroamphetamine & powder / crystals\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 1 mg & oral & Pharms - Lorazepam & pill / tablet\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I took 1mg of lorazepam and 40mg of 4-Fluoroamphetamine.  The effects of the 4-FA were a little stronger than caffeine is just before it gets jittery.



I was talkative and alert, but without any jittering or jaw grinding.  The effects passed after about 4 hours and no ill after effects were noted.  I usually go for 80-120mg for full effects of this substance.



I took a drug test the next day for the military and 4-FA did not show up, but the lorazepam did.

\end{document}
